A violin consists of a body or corpus, a neck, a finger board, a bridge, a 
soundpost, four strings, and various fittings. The fittings are the tuning pegs, 
tailpiece and tailgut, endpin, possibly one or more fine tuners on the tailpiece, 
and usually a chinrest, either attached directly over the tailpiece or to the left of it.
